note.p: Death: His house, Brook Street, London (27 October 1873)

Career: Articled clerk to a mercantile house, Liverpool; obtained a release from his articles in order to study medicine (1811); travelled to Iceland with Sir George Mackenzie and Richard Bright (1810); travelled to Portugal, Sardinia, Sicily, Greece and the Ionian Islands (1812); Domestic Physician to Caroline, Princess of Wales (1814); had an extensive practice; Physician Extraordinary to William IV and to Queen Victoria; Physician in Ordinary to Queen Victoria (1852)
